items.title: Connecting To Fortinet VPN From CLI
items.summary: Forticlient VPN provides a GUI client for Ubuntu, Mac & Windows. However these cannot be installed on servers where GUI is not available. However these is openfortivpn, an open source client client for PPP+SSL VPN tunnel services which is compatible with Fortinet VPNs. This is available for all Linux & Mac machines.
items.content_html:
Forticlient VPN provides a GUI client for Ubuntu, Mac & Windows. However these cannot be installed on servers where GUI is not available. 

However these is openfortivpn, an open source client client for PPP+SSL VPN tunnel services which is compatible with Fortinet VPNs. This is available for all Linux & Mac machines. 

Install openfortivpn with the OS package manager.

$ sudo apt install openfortivpn # for Ubuntu
$ brew install openfortivpn  # for Mac  

Create a config file(vpn.ini) for VPN as follows with VPN credentials.

host = vpn-gateway-address
port = 443
username = vpn-username
password = vpn-password

 Start the CLI client with the following command.

$ sudo openfortivpn -c vpn.ini
INFO: Tunnel is up and running.

For more options, check out openfortivpn docs.
